markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Transposable Compliance](/Feats.aspx?ID=3928) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Fleshwarp" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=338" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Impossible Lands](/Sources.aspx?ID=146) pg. 29</row>

</column>

---

Your protean vitality is fecund and many-succoring: your veins run with life-giving ichor that adapts to the blood and physiology of any body, and your skin molts on command, creating wound-stanching sheaths of tissue for yourself and others. You become trained in [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9). If you were already trained in Medicine, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You can [Administer First Aid](/Actions.aspx?ID=54) without [healer's tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=25) by using your physiology instead, but you must take 1 damage to make the attempt. Similarly, you can [Treat Wounds](/Actions.aspx?ID=57) without healer's tools but take 2d8 damage. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on all Medicine checks to Administer First Aid and Treat Wounds using your own physiology.
name: Transposable Compliance

summary_markdown: Your protean vitality is fecund and many-succoring: your veins run with life-giving ichor that adapts to the blood and physiology of any body, and your skin molts on command, creating wound-stanching sheaths of tissue for yourself and others.
text: <title level="1" right="Feat 5" pfs="Standard" > Transposable Compliance Source Impossible Lands pg. 29 --- Your protean vitality is fecund and many-succoring: your veins run with life-giving ichor that adapts to the blood and physiology of any body, and your skin molts on command, creating wound-stanching sheaths of tissue for yourself and others. You become trained in Medicine. If you were already trained in Medicine, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You can Administer First Aid without healer's tools by using your physiology instead, but you must take 1 damage to make the attempt. Similarly, you can Treat Wounds without healer's tools but take 2d8 damage. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on all Medicine checks to Administer First Aid and Treat Wounds using your own physiology.
